reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Oscar for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The outside of the hotel is really eye-catching and interesting but doesn't seem out of place in the plaza. That was a decent start, the reception staff were friendly and helpful although apart from checking in and out I had no need to speak to them. The rooms are different, for a start I agree with a number of the other reviews that the lighting system is a joke. It was just a case of pressing all of the buttons until you gor the desired result! We didn't mind the glass bathroom and the shower was absolutely glorious. I would describe the room as functional and it was a shame the only window looked into a hole in the middle of the building resulting in very little natural light. I paid a very low rate for the room though so wasn't too put out by this. The big apples left on your pillow each morning was a nice touch and the breakfast was tasty and plentiful. The location was a major bonus for the price, we were able to walk almost everywhere and it's in a quiet little square. I loved Madrid, can't wait to go back and although I will probably try another hotel, I would happily recommend the Oscar.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, great city

likes.liked: — The location and the free apples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: However, when we initially checked in, we were given a room with a completely soaked carpet outside of the bathroom. We initially thought it was a leak from the a/c, but the staff simply brought their housekeeper up to talk to us who was embarrassed to admit she spilled water from a bucket. No big deal, except they were completely booked and only could give us a handicap room - or move us the next day. We opted to move the next day and were given a (very) slight upgrade. Our first room had a view of a wall. The second room had a view of the plaza, which was an improvement to be sure.
